title: Eddie Jones insists England’s best performance is yet to come as they prepare to face South Africa in World Cup final
text:
Eddie Jones has insisted England’s best performance is yet to come, as his squad prepare to face South Africa in the World Cup final on the back of Saturday’s stunning demolition of New Zealand.

South Africa promised to “fight fire with fire” against England after they booked their place in the final in Yokohama next Saturday with a 19-16 victory over Wales on Sunday, with Handre Pollard’s 76th-minute penalty ending Warren Gatland’s hopes of a fairy-tale finish to his 12-year tenure.

The Wales coach claimed afterwards that England would struggle to repeat their performance in Saturday’s 19-7 semi-final victory over the defending world champions which ranked as one of the greatest in their history....
description: Eddie Jones has insisted England’s best performance is yet to come, as his  squad prepare to face South Africa in the World Cup final on the back of Saturday’s stunning demolition of New Zealand.
